alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 4:03AM EST until January 12 at 9:10AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Dinwiddie and Brunswick Counties. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Rawlings. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flow across Harpers Bridge Road about an 1/8 of a mile north of the river. Farm land north of river along Beaver Pond Creek also floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:50 AM EST Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:50 AM EST Thursday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.4 feet on 05/19/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
